title: Can reality be broken down into parts? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. You had the big bang. Then confusion created observation. Waves became particles Particles became atomsdial Atoms became neutronstars Neutronstars became primordial black holes Primordial black holes became multiverse Universe us but one of many Less observation cause black holes to leak radiation Radiation cause microscopic black holes Microscopic black holes feed from decay atoms, and later feed from atoms. Conscious particles seeking understanding evolve all possibilities. Possibilities evolve thought. Thought undo reality Thought merge with understanding Understanding reduce space No space is understanding Understanding is harmony Harmony is big bang!

Consider the 4 alchemical elements Earth, Water, Air, and Fire. On a human level these represent the four “worlds” we live in - Physical, Emotional, Intellectual, Spiritual. Reality, from a human standpoint, comprises of input from all these 4 sources, to varying degrees depending on which worlds we are centred on. Any movement in one world effects the others. None are higher or lower, but all are equal parts of our existence as living sentient beings.

This is kind of a trick question. Because, clearly, reality can be broken down into parts, but when you do that it’s no longer reality. Fully understanding reality requires us to consider parts and whole at the same time. This requires two sets of assumptions and methods.
If one cut a blank page into many parts does anything change. All parts are still blank. So is reality. All parts are real.
